review.title: Abstracting Probabilistic Actions
review.abstract: this related paper discusses the problem of naturally abstracting conditional probabilistic actions. we identify two distinct types of language abstraction : separate intra - action abstraction and another inter - integrated action abstraction. these we totally define what proposition it therefore means except for the abstraction of teaching an action task to be correct and then all derive two methods : of improving intra - action abstraction and two automated methods characteristic of supporting inter - functional action abstraction which are correct according themselves to this criterion. we illustrate about the developed modeling techniques by applying them to actions described with the hierarchical temporal action representation matrix used in the dev drips decision - maker theoretic planner and thus we basically describe importantly how the developmental planner currently uses abstraction to economically reduce the procedural complexity of planning.
histories: Appears in Proceedings of the Tenth Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence (UAI1994)
review.COMMENTS: Appears in Proceedings of the Tenth Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence (UAI1994)
